intro: Microlicia polychaeta, commonly known as the hairy microlicia, is a flowering plant species native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pale yellow. It has hairy stems and leaves, which give it its common name. Microlicia polychaeta is often found in moist, shaded forest understories.
